segments.text: How often do you use the internet ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I use it almost every day , but I usually only use it to check my email . I don ’ t often surf the net . You use the internet a lot , don ’ t you ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes . I use it to find products and components at the lowest price for my company . It can be frustrating when the connection is poor .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: So , you ’ re online eight hours a day .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , I like the job though . Sometimes , I help other people in the office if they ’ re having trouble online .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: How useful do you think the internet is as a source of information ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I think it ’ s fairly useful , but there are two big problems . First , a lot of the information you find online is false . Second , when you buy something online , you don ’ t see it until you actually get it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: How do you solve the website problems when you ’ re buying something online ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What I do is find the website of shops . Then someone from our company visits the shop and buys when they ’ re seen that the products are genuine and suitable .
segments.speaker: S1
